intro: Lappula foliosa, commonly known as the broad-leaved lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in fields and along roadsides. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it has a short growing season. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its adaptability and unique morphological features.
